lines.content: The BEBE is designed to help users manage their tasks efficiently using various commands. Users can add, delete, mark tasks as done, and search for specific tasks based on keywords. The application supports different types of tasks, including Todos, Deadlines, and Events. It operates through a simple command-line interface (CLI).
This guide will walk you through the installation, usage, and available commands.
- Operating System: Any system that supports Java (Windows, macOS, Linux).
Download the source code files from the repository or the provided distribution package. Ensure that the following files are included:
Navigate to the folder where the files are located and compile the files using the `javac` command in your terminal:
Once compiled, you can run the application using:
Once the program is running, you can start entering commands to manage your tasks. The available commands are listed in the **Commands** section below.
Each command follows a specific format that should be adhered to. If an invalid format is detected, the system will provide an appropriate error message.
Adds a new ToDo task to the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Adds a new Deadline task to the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a new Event task to the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Displays all tasks currently in the list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks the task at the specified index as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Unmarks the task at the specified index (marks it as not done).
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Deletes the task at the specified index.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Searches for tasks that contain the specified keyword in their description.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Displays a list of available commands and their usage.
Exits the application, saving the current list of tasks.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
If the system does not recognize a command, it will return an error message such as:
If a command is entered without the required arguments (e.g., `mark` without a task number), the system will notify you of the missing information:
The 'mark' command requires a valid task number.
If you try to mark, delete, or unmark a task that does not exist (e.g., task number 10 when there are only 5 tasks), the system will alert you:
If an invalid date format is entered for a deadline or event, the system will respond with:
The 'deadline' command requires a valid date format (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD).
If no command is entered, the system will prompt the user to enter a valid command:
Please enter a valid command. Type 'help' to see available commands.
The system automatically saves tasks upon exiting the application. When you restart the application, your previous tasks will be loaded automatically, allowing you to continue where you left off.

This Task Management System provides an easy-to-use interface for managing tasks of different types. By following the commands listed in this guide, you can keep track of todos, deadlines, and events effectively. For any help or clarification, use the `help` command at any time.
* Represents the command to add a new task to the task list.
* Supports adding ToDo, Deadline, and Event types.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task type and description.
* @param taskType   The type of task to add (e.g., todo, deadline, event).
* @param description The description of the task.

* @return A LocalDateTime object representing the parsed date and time.
* @throws BebeException if the format is incorrect.
private LocalDateTime parseDateTime(String dateTimeString) throws BebeException {
throw new BebeException("Invalid date/time format. Use yyyy-MM-dd HHmm.");
* Executes the add command by adding a new task to the task list.
* Depending on the task type, it will create a ToDo, Deadline, or Event.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks where the new task will be added.
* @param ui      The UI object to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage object to save tasks.
* @throws BebeException if an invalid task type or format is provided.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BebeException {

if (eventParts.length < 3) throw new BebeException("The event command requires /from and /to arguments.");
ui.show("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.getTaskCount() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new BebeException("Invalid input format. Please check your command.");
* Main class representing the Bebe application that runs the task manager.
* It initializes the necessary components such as UI, storage, and task list.
* Constructs a Bebe instance with the specified file path for task storage.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are saved and loaded from.
* Starts the Bebe application and enters the main command loop.
* Main method to start the Bebe application.
* Represents a custom exception specific to the Bebe application.
* Constructs a BebeException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message associated with the exception.
* Abstract class representing a command in the Bebe application.
* All command types such as AddCommand, DeleteCommand, and ExitCommand
* Executes the command. Each command type implements its own execution logic.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks where the command is executed.
* @param ui      The UI object to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage object to save or load tasks.
* @throws BebeException if any error occurs during the execution of the command.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BebeException;
* Returns whether this command will exit the program.
* @return true if the command is the exit command, false otherwise.
* Represents a Deadline task with a due date and time.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the specified description and due date/time.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The due date/time for the task as a LocalDateTime.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task, including its description and due date/time.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task, formatted for saving to a file.
* The due date/time is formatted as 'yyyy-MM-dd HHmm' to preserve precision.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task in file format.
* Formats the due date to a readable format (e.g., Dec 2 2019, 6:00 PM).
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy, h:mm a");
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index The index of the task to delete.
* @throws BebeException if the index is not a valid number.
throw new BebeException("Invalid task number format.");

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BebeException {
throw new BebeException("Task does not exist.");
* Represents an Event task with a description, start time, and end time.

* Formats the start time to a readable format (e.g., Dec 2 2019, 6:00 PM).

* Formats the end time to a readable format (e.g., Dec 2 2019, 8:00 PM).

* Represents a command to exit the Bebe application.
* When executed, this command will terminate the program.
* Executes the exit command, showing a goodbye message to the user.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks (not used in this command).
* @param ui      The UI object to display the goodbye message.
* @param storage The storage object (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.show("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Returns true to indicate that this command will exit the program.
* @return true, as this is the exit command.
* Represents the command to find tasks that match a given keyword.
* The search is case-insensitive and checks if the keyword is present in the task descriptions.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.

* Displays all tasks that match the keyword in their descriptions.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to search through.
* @param ui      The UI object to display results to the user.
* @param storage The storage object (not used in this command).
* @throws BebeException if there is an issue with finding tasks (e.g., invalid keyword).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BebeException {

* Represents a command to display help information to the user.

* @param tasks   The list of tasks (not used in this command).
* @param ui      The UI object to display the help message.
* @param storage The storage object (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task list.
* When executed, this command displays all tasks to the user.
* Executes the list command by displaying all tasks in the task list.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to display.
* @param ui      The UI object to display the list of tasks.
* @param storage The storage object (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.show("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Represents the command to mark or unmark a task as done or not done.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified task index and marking status.
* @param index  The index of the task to mark/unmark.
* @param isMark If true, marks the task as done; otherwise, marks it as not done.
* @throws BebeException if the index is not a valid number.
this.taskIndex = Integer.parseInt(index) - 1; // Convert from user input (1-based index) to 0-based index.
* Executes the mark command to either mark or unmark a task in the task list.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks where the task is located.
* @param ui      The UI object to display results to the user.
* @param storage The storage object to save tasks.
* @throws BebeException if the task index is out of range.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BebeException {
tasks.markTask(taskIndex); // Mark the task as done
ui.show("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  " + tasks.getTasks().get(taskIndex));
ui.show("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n  " + tasks.getTasks().get(taskIndex));
throw new BebeException("Task does not exist.");

* Marks a task as not done by its index.

* Returns the total number of tasks in the task list.
* Represents a Todo task in the task list. A Todo task only has a description
* without a specific due date or time.

* Handles user input and output. Manages interaction between the user and the Bebe application.
* Responsible for reading user commands and displaying output messages.
private final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Bebe, your task manager.");
System.out.println("What can I do for you today?");
* Reads and returns the user's input command.
* @return The user's input as a trimmed string.
* Displays a horizontal line to separate sections of the output.
* Displays an error message for when tasks fail to load from storage.
* Displays an error message to the user.

* Displays a general message to the user.
* Displays the list of available commands to the user.
System.out.println("Here are the commands you can use:");
System.out.println("  todo <task description>          - Adds a ToDo task.");
System.out.println("  deadline <task description> /by <date/time>  - Adds a Deadline task.");
System.out.println("  event <task description> /from <start time> /to <end time>  - Adds an Event task.");
System.out.println("  mark <task number>              - Marks a task as done.");
System.out.println("  unmark <task number>            - Marks a task as not done.");
System.out.println("  delete <task number>            - Deletes a task.");
System.out.println("  find                            - Shows all task that matches ur description.");
System.out.println("  help                            - Shows this help message.");
